member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyStore.GeneratePolicyFromFacet(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.ObjectToValidate})
member.summary: This method instantiates a Policy object in memory which applies to the given target. The policy is associated with a Condition whose ConditionExpression objects reflect the properties of the target as seen through the given facet at the time this method is called. None of these objects have had Create called on them yet so they are only in memory.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyStore.DoCreatePolicyFromFacet(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This method does the actual creation of the policy from the facet. This method does validation of the created policy regardless of whether the policy is created to be persisted in the store, or just to be serialized.
If the caller requested committing the policy, it means the policy is to be created in the current policy store backend, otherwise, a temp store is created the policy and the policy object and temp store are discareded after the policy is serialized.
member.param: If true, the caller requires the policy to be committed to the policy store.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyStore.CreatePolicyFromFacet(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Sdk.Sfc.SfcQueryExpression,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method instantiates a Policy object which applies to the given target, and then add the policy to permanent storage. The policy is associated with a Condition whose ConditionExpression objects reflect the properties of the target as seen through the given facet at the time this method is called. You can access the newly created policy through this PolicyStore's Policies[policyName] collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyStore.CreatePolicyFromFacet(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Sdk.Sfc.SfcQueryExpression,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: This method instantiates a temporary Policy object and then serializes it through the given XmlWriter. The policy is associated with a Condition whose ConditionExpression objects reflect the properties of the target as seen through the given facet at the time this method is called. This PolicyStore object is not changed by this call.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyStore.CreatePolicyFromFacet(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: This method instantiates a Policy object which applies to the given target, and then add the policy to permanent storage. The policy is associated with a Condition whose ConditionExpression objects reflect the properties of the target as seen through the given facet at the time this method is called. You can access the newly created policy through this PolicyStore's Policies[policyName] collection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyStore.ImportPolicy(System.Xml.XmlReader,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.ImportPolicyEnabledState,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Import a single policy from the given XML reader. The reader should be previously created by a supported Export method. The imported Policy is also created in the PolicyStore on the server.
member.param: The XML reader to import from.

The Policy.Enabled flag will be set based on this enum value. The exception is if the policy's execution mode is Check on Schedule but there is no schedule information associated with the policy, in which case the policy is automatically disabled and its execution mode is reset to None.
If true, then if a Policy of the same name already exists in the Store then it will be overwritten.

If true, then if any Condition associated with the Policy, either directly or through a TargetSet, already exists in the Store then it will be overwritten. Otherwise the existing condition will remain unchanged and the imported policy will use the pre-existing condition rather than the version in the XmlReader.
member.returns: The Policy object imported. If the XML reader fails to validate properly or is missing it will throw an exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Dmf.PolicyStore.DeserializePolicy(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deserialize a single policy from the given XML reader. The reader should be previously created by a supported Export method. The deserialized Policy exists in-memory only and must be created in the PolicyStore on the server to persist it.
member.param: The XML reader to import from.
If true, then if a Policy of the same name already exists in the Store then it will be overwritten.
If true, then if any Condition associated with the Policy, either directly or through a TargetSet already exists in the Store then it will be overwritten.
member.returns: The Policy object imported. If the XML reader fails to validate properly it may throw an exception.
